questions.question: If you go star gazing throughout the year you will notice.

choices.answer: You can see stars move throughout the year.
You will see the same star patterns all year.
You can see different star patterns each season.
You will notice some stars stay in place while others move.

questions.question: Which best describes a galaxy?

choices.answer: a group of planets, moons that orbit planets, gas, and dust
gas, dust, billions of stars, and planets
a planet, moons that orbit the planet, gas, and dust
a star, planets that orbit the star, gas, and dust

questions.question: Which statement best compares the Sun and Earth.

choices.answer: They are similar in size, and Earth revolves around the Sun.
They are similar in size, and the Sun revolves around Earth.
The Sun is much larger, and the Sun revolves around Earth.
The Sun is much larger, and Earth revolves around the Sun.

questions.question: This object revolves around a planet and is smaller than a planet.  What is the object?

choices.answer: asteroid
comet
moon
meteor

questions.question: This object is made up of rock, ice and gas. It also has a tail when it gets close to the sun.

choices.answer: asteroid
comet
moon
meteor

questions.question: This object is made up of only rock and can be as large as a city or as small as a pebble.

choices.answer: asteroid
moon
planet
comet

questions.question: Which position shows winter in the Northern Hemisphere?
Which moon phase would you see from Earth?

choices.answer: quarter moon
full moon
third quarter
new moon

questions.question: Which moon phase would you see from Earth?

choices.answer: first quarter
full moon
third quarter
new moon

questions.question: What is the correct order of the moon phases in the Northern Hemisphere?

choices.answer: Last Quarter Moon, Full Moon, New Moon, First Quarter Moon
First Quarter Moon, Full Moon, Last Quarter Moon, New Moon
New Moon, Full Moon, Last Quarter Moon, First Quarter Moon
Full Moon, First Quarter Moon, New Moon, Last Quarter Moon

questions.question: Why does it look like the moon is changing shape in the sky?

choices.answer: The sun is revolving around the Earth.
The moon is revolving around the Earth.
The Earth is revolving around the sun.
The Earth is revolving around the moon.

questions.question: The stars appear to slowly move across the sky through the night. What causes this to happen?

choices.answer: The stars move slowly from east to west.
The moons  revolution around the Earth.
The Earths revolution around the sun.
The Earth rotating on it axis.

questions.question: When Earth revolves around the sun it takes...

choices.answer: 365 days
24 hrs
29 1/2 days
10 years

questions.question: Earth makes one full rotation on its axis in

choices.answer: 365 days
24 hrs
29 1/2 days
2 days

questions.question: Why do we see the sun rise and set each day>

choices.answer: because Earth rotates on its axis once every 24 hours
because the Sun revolves around Earth
because Earth revolves around the Sun
because the Sun rotates on its axis once every 24 hours

questions.question: What would most likely occur if the Earth rotated slower?

choices.answer: The length of a year would be longer.
The length of year would be shorter.
Days and nights would be shorter.
Days and nights would be longer.

questions.question: Which statement correctly compares the galaxy and our solar system.

choices.answer: They both contain many stars and planets.
There are many galaxies within our solar system.
The galaxy the much larger than the solar system.
Our solar system has a sun and the galaxy does not.

questions.question: What can be found between the inner and outer planets?

choices.answer: the kuiper belt
a dwarf planet
many comets
the asteroid belt

questions.question: The name of our galaxy is

choices.answer: The Asteroid Belt
The Kuiper belt
The Milky Way
The Andromeda

questions.question: How are inner and outer planets different?

choices.answer: Inner planets are smaller and closer to the sun.
Outer planets are made of gas and inner planets are solid.
The outer planets have many moons unlike the inner planets.
All of the following statements are correct.
